dmca.title: [ABUSE] Cease and Desist Notice
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Thursday, February 09, 2006 5:24 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; dominic@dynamediauk.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Cease and Desist Notice]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Cease and Desist Notice
Date: Thu, 09 Feb 2006 23:09:29 +0000
From: Dominic Bunn <dominic@dynamediauk.com>
To: priority@unlockcarradios.co.uk,  dominic@dynamediauk.com,
misuse@fasthosts.co.uk,  abuse@theplanet.com

Dear Sir / Madam,

cc'ed to domain administrator (misuse@fasthosts.co.uk
<mailto:misuse@fasthosts.co.uk>) and apparent host (abuse@theplanet.com
<mailto:abuse@theplanet.com>)

It has come to my attention that intellectual property belonging to my
company has been duplicated without authorisation within your websites at:

http://www.unlockcarradio.co.uk
http://www.unlockcarradios.co.uk
http://www.carradio-code.co.uk
http://www.carradio-decode.co.uk
http://www.unlockcarstereo.co.uk
http://www.decode-carradios.co.uk

I therefore request that you immediately:

a) remove all intellectual property duplicated from my company's website at
http://www.decodemyradio.co.uk and
b) as required by The Business Names Act 1985, provide by return email

   * the corporate name of your business;
   * the name of each partner, or
   * the individual's name, and
   * in relation to each person named, an address in Great Britain at which
documents can be served.

In the event that the above requests are not met within 7 working days,
further action may be taken without further notice.

This action may include (but not be limited to) any or all of the following:
i) Notification of failure to comply with current business legislation to
Trading Standards.
ii) Advisory notification to Her Majesty's Revenues and Customs of
potentially unregistered business.
iii) County Court Summons for breach of copyright, plus costs incurred in
response and modification of site to avoid potential ranking penalties.
iv) A Digital Millenium Copyright Act complaint to Google and all other
major search engines.

Yours Faithfully
Dominic Bunn
t/a Dynamedia



- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.2 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFD6875vK/XpJs6oyURAg5pAJ9aVBs9g3BSu0G/HvO5vuIxLj3FyACgnEOH
BSvq0Fhof/ivevHbWk/dqPE=
=CjbV
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
